comments.commentBody: I think the owners are about to be struck by the realization that they are -- in fact -- partners with the players.  The League as we know it and the successes it has achieved, are the result of a collaboration with its players.  Absent that collaboration, the League will be a dysfunctional mess, since all their attempts at collective action may potentially fall afoul of anti-trust law.  The only escape from that is through collective bargaining with the Union.  The owners don't know yet that their own success is linked with its partnership with the Union and the players.  They will learn.
Right now, all that matters is helping our fellow Americans.

Food for thought - thanks.

Today my magpie reading turned up some related information, and the morning news provided an almost perfect example of shock and trance - a transition from the catastrophic events in the latest bangup storms to the upcoming wedding. Too much information, perhaps, but it's what we've got. On the former, following water vapor maps over a period of time shows the evolution of storms is following a pattern. Science tries to make it clear that *no single storm* can be attributed to climate change but the *trend over time and space* is characteristic of what we can expect. This is exploited to encourage us to ignore what we can see and feel as we reel in shock from one natural catastrophe to another. We are ill served by this attempt to distract us from the need to look at our expanding population and consumption model on a finite planet, an irresistible force meeting an immovable object.

It is important to understand that increasing greenhouse gases, despite their minority status in our atmosphere (and the undoubted fact that water vapor only amplifies the effect, though that too has increased with warming), have changed the way heat is reflected outwards, and that this pattern is accelerating, so the relatively small effects so far are just a taste of what is likely. This has increased the energy in the system, and changed the circulation patterns to a certain extent. (Our more experienced scientific commenters can perhaps improve on this amateur synopsis, but I think I have the rough idea right.)

For those who like gorgeous animations, watching these is a treat, whatever you think of the effects, and you'll be able to watch patterns as they cross/evolve from west to east:
http://weather.unisys.com/satellite/sat_wv_hem_loop-12.gif

@32 Rudy Ludeke - "But one of the contributors is Roger Pielke, Sr., a noted and controversial anti-GW advocate, who is frequently criticized for his inconsistency and lack of rigor"

I can't find any source of information to support your claim that Roger Pielke Sr, is a contributor to C3 Headlines. Can you supply your source supporting your contention?

Also, you link to the OSS foundation I assume to offer them as a source to support your contention that Roger Pielke Sr. is, "criticized for his inconsistency and lack of rigor". However OSS Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) corporation offering consulting and educational services. They are not a scientific organization. Here is the founder's profile at the web site:

"Founder - John P. Reisman brings more than 20 years experience in studying and developing systems and performing various types of analysis. Leading a dual career path, he also worked in media production, engineering and management in areas including music, radio, television, and film.

John worked at the University of the World with Dr. James Grier Miller, Author of Living Systems Theory and Dr. Martin Chamberlain, doing research in educational systems. While at the university, he wrote a simplified systems theory for understanding general systems operation and dynamics, and developed a methodology to help understand the health of a given system. He worked, with the assistance of Dr. Jonas Salk, developing The Learning Center/PATH Project, which was presented to the US Department of Education and EDUCOM and developed the TLC/PATH project for the Reagan administrations, 'School 2000' project.

More recently he has conducted research, analysis and development efforts in energy efficient urban and industrial structures and was awarded a patent for a time management system he invented. John typically works with entrepreneurs and companies in early stages of innovative projects in feasibility and market identification.

John studied engineering and early in his career worked in the media industry in production; and for the Department of Defense while living at the NATO base in Iceland. After 9/11 he worked with Homeland Security to help bring the TSA security force up to speed.

He enjoys writing, and examining systems interaction and dynamics. Most recently he has applied his examinations to climate, energy, and economic systems as well as synergies and inter-dynamic relationships in these areas."

The other person at OSS Foundation is a PR person who I doubt is qualified to judge Dr. Pielke Sr's qualifications as a climate scientist.

Can you offer any unbiased non-corporate source of information from any scientific organizations that have "frequently criticized" Dr. Pielke Sr., "for his inconsistency and lack of rigor" in his duies as a climate scientist, as you contend?
